logic.board module¶

class logic.board.Board(player_1, player_2)¶

Bases: object

Board class that stores all the chess pieces.

move_on_board(x, y)¶

Checks to see if a move is on the board

Parameters

  • x (Int) – X location

  • y (Int) – Y location

Returns

Whether or not an (x, y) pair is on the board

Return type

Boolean

place_initial_pieces()¶

“Creates a dictionary with chess pieces and their start locations.

Returns

Dictionary with pieces and their locations

Return type

Dictionary

Colors for the board and pieces.

BLACK = 'Black'¶

logic.game module¶

class logic.game.Game(board, player_1, player_2)¶

Bases: object

Game class that contains the main function for the chess game (move). The main function in main.py simply runs move over and over again until the game is over.

can_escape(player)¶

Determines whether or not a player can escape check.

Parameters

player (Player) – Player who is in check.

Returns

Whether or not the player can escape check.

Return type

Boolean

get_move_choice(piece_location, moving, opponent)¶

Gets the location of the square the player wants to move to.

Parameters

  • piece_location (String (of len 2 with Column then Row ex A7)) – The location of the piece to be moved

  • moving (Player) – Player who is currently trying to move

  • opponent (Player) – Player who is not moving

Returns

The location the player wants to move

Return type

String

get_piece_choice(moving)¶

Ask the player what piece they want to move.

Parameters

moving (Player) – The player whose turn it is

Returns

The location of the piece to move

Return type

string of length 2 (ex. A7, D8…)

is_checked(player)¶

Check to see if a player checked.

Parameters

player (Player) – The player who may or may not be checked.

Returns

Whether or not a player is checked

Return type

Boolean

is_over()¶

Returns whether or not the game is over.

Returns

Whether or not the game is over

Return type

boolean

move()¶

Executes a single players turn.

move_is_valid(piece_location, move_choice, moving, opponent)¶

Checks to see if a move is a valid move.

Parameters

  • piece_location (String (len 2 with format Column Row ex. A7)) – Location of the piece to be moved

  • move_choice (String (len 2 with format Column Row ex. A7)) – Where the player wants to move to

  • moving (Player) – Player who is moving

  • opponnent – Player not moving

Returns

Whether or not the move is valid

Return type

Boolean

move_piece(piece_choice, move_choice, moving, opponent)¶

Moves a piece between two squares. Captures opponent’s piece should it exist.

Parameters

  • piece_choice (String (Two chars long. Column Row ex. A7, D8...)) – The location of the piece to move.

  • move_choice (String (Two chars long. Column Row ex. A7, D8...)) – The location of the square to move to.

  • moving (Player) – The player whose turn it is.

  • opponent (Player) – The player not moving.

parse_board_choice(move_choice)¶

Takes in a valid move location and returns corresponding x, y coords.

Parameters

move_choice – Location being parsed

Type

String (must be a valid location)

Returns

(x, y) tuple

Return type

tuple

piece_is_valid(piece_choice, player)¶

Checks to see if the player can move the piece at specified location.

Parameters

  • piece_choice (String) – Location of piece to move

  • player (Player) – Player who is currently moving

Returns

None, Boolean, or String (that contains info on why move is invalid)

temp_move_is_checked(piece_location, move_choice, moving, opponent, parsed=False)¶

Temporarily executes a move to see if it puts the mover in a checked state.

Parameters

  • piece_location (String (of len two Ex. E8)) – Location of the piece to be moved

  • move_choice (String (of len two Ex. E8)) – Location the player wants to move to

  • moving (Player) – The player who is executing the move

  • opponent (Player) – The player who is not moving

  • parsed (Boolean) – Optional argument stating whether or not move_choice and piece_location have already been converted to x, y values.

Returns

Whether or not a move leaves the player checked

Return type

Boolean

valid_board_location(location)¶

Checks to see if a location is a valid board location.

Parameters

location (String) – The location being checked

Returns

Whether or not a move leaves a player checked.

Return type

Boolean

logic.player module¶

class logic.player.Player(color)¶

Bases: object

Player class. Could be extended to include things like a name, record, etc. Currently keeps track of the players pieces and their color.

logic.square module¶

class logic.square.Square(color, x, y, piece=None)¶

Bases: object

Square class that emulates a square you would see on a chess board. A square can possible hold a piece and the square will be either white or black.
